sentence: Bcl-2 family proteins regulate DNA-damage-induced apoptosis by regulating the release of mitochondrial cytochrome C in response to DNA damage (Nunez et al., 1998) (Figure 1).
In addition, PI3K/AKT, NF-κB, Stat3, and other signalling pathways are also involved in the regulation of cisplatin resistance (Mitsuuchi et al., 2000) (Figure 2).
